Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Encountering test failures in System.Numerics.Tests.GenericVectorTests on Android when Hybrid AOT + LLVM are enabled " (#1452) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
In addition to the failures reported in #1451, I'm seeing roughly 17 additional test failures in `System.Numerics.Tests.GenericVectorTests` on Android when Hybrid AOT and LLVM are enabled. Failure messages and stack traces can be found in the test result xml gist below.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download and run the attached prebuilt .apk file:
> `adb install 15-7-hybridaotllvm-Xamarin.Android.Bcl_Tests-Signed.apk`
> `adb shell am instrument -w Xamarin.Android.Bcl_Tests/xamarin.android.bcltests.XUnitInstrumentation`

2. Alternatively, a smaller repro which contains the relevant test source could likely be built and installed with Hybrid AOT+LLVM enabled.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Details
Link to .apk file - https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/p/pecolli/EbyqYRYKfM1ErMMTq6w4dugBCr378Gn9JDw0e0XrBuRphw?e=binbA2
Link to obj output - https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/p/pecolli/EVP87hYi1kdLgt442SzN9ksBcnpcgQw0Nqjnec_rOWp7jw?e=VQw7l8

### Version Information
Windows 10 w/ VS 15.7
Xamarin.Android SDK 8.3.0.5 (HEAD/1a8ed5388)
<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

https://gist.githubusercontent.com/pjcollins/c5114d91600bf377ba5ae39aba8a8307/raw/a708a9d09d463a71db2c99261ecfa75223341562/BclXUnit_release_hybridaot_llvmTestResult-7251d290.xml

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Encountering BCL test failures in System.Numerics.Tests on Android when AOT + LLVM are enabled" (#1451) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm seeing failures in the following new XUnit tests when AOT and LLVM are enabled. Failure messages and stack traces can be found in the test result xml linked at the bottom.
```
System.Numerics.Tests.Matrix4x4Tests.Matrix4x4CreateReflectionTest01
System.Numerics.Tests.Matrix4x4Tests.Matrix4x4CreateShadowTest02
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneConstructorTest
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneConstructorTest1
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneConstructorTest3
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneCreateFromVerticesTest
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneEqualityTest
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneEqualsNanTest
System.Numerics.Tests.PlaneTests.PlaneInequalityTest
```
### Steps to Reproduce

1) Download prebuilt .apk file, and run it on an armeabi-v8a device:
> `adb install 15-7-aotllvm-Xamarin.Android.Bcl_Tests-Signed.apk`
> `adb shell am instrument -w Xamarin.Android.Bcl_Tests/xamarin.android.bcltests.XUnitInstrumentation`

2) Alternatively, a smaller repro which contains the relevant test source could likely be built and installed with AOT+LLVM enabled.

1) Download and run the attached prebuilt .apk file:

2) Alternatively, a smaller repro which just contains the relevant test source could likely be built and installed with Hybrid AOT+LLVM enabled.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ObjectDisposedException on Xamarin Forms Listview" (#2793) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
This error occurs when navigating between pages with complex-row listviews. Since no user code is involved it's not possible to catch and handle the exception.

Note: This has been split off as a separate bug from Issue #2421 and #2406 , based on guidance from @hartez. There are at least three other related issues.

### Steps to Reproduce
Navigating pages and scrolling and coming back and forth causes the application to crash.

### Expected Behavior
Should work fine

### Actual Behavior
App crashes a lot while navigating to and fro pages

### Basic Information
Version with issue: Latest
Last known good version: NA (tried on all versions starting 2.3)
IDE:VS 2017
Platform Target Frameworks:
Android: 8.0
Android Support Library Version: 26.1.1
Nuget Packages:
Affected Devices: Tested on Samsung Note 8, Mi Note 4 etc.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild] Move from xbuild to msbuild" (#4111) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "msbuild-mac tests should be running with msbuild in addition to xbuild" (#4110) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Initial bug: https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=53164 (moving out of bugzilla due to future read-only mode).

This is a tracking bug for updating the tests to support msbuild.

There are at least two tests that are disabled for now until this is fixed.

They can not be enabled yet, so we don't have the infrastructure to build msbuild tests without using the global install, which does not work on bots.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild] Unbreak netstd2 project msbuild support" (#4109) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4067
- Broken by https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/371a1d54e782c0044e984b5407079080cff50164
- The refactor into Xamarin.Mac.TargetFrameworkFix.targets was incorrect, and the ItemGroup needed
to be run after GetReferenceAssemblyPaths, not after FixDesignTimeFacades.
- This would have been caught by existing tests, but they were not enabled due to msbuild redirect issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[d15-7] Broken API binding causes crashes in user code when running on touchbar machines" (#4074) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This needs to go into 15-7

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3824

The touchbar bindings are wrong, and that can cause assertions/crashes in user's code

### Steps to Reproduce

1. New XM App
2. Add this code:

```
NSTextView f = new NSTextView (new CGRect (400, 200, 200, 200));
            f.TextDidChange += (o, e) => {
                Console.WriteLine (e);
            };


            View.AddSubview (f);
```
3. 

### Expected Behavior

No crash/assert.

### Actual Behavior

2018-05-08 20:50:04.242 VisualStudio[32290:908450] *** Assertion failure in -[NSTouchBar setDefaultItemIdentifiers:], /BuildRoot/Library/Caches/com.apple.xbs/Sources/AppKit/AppKit-1561.40.112/TouchBar.subproj/NSTouchBar.m:163

This also happens in VSfM, but not my small sample.

2018-05-08 20:50:04.246 VisualStudio[32290:908450] *** Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'NSInternalInconsistencyException', reason: 'Invalid parameter not satisfying: itemIdentifiers'

### Environment
Stable

> VS bug [#614306](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/614306)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Not all assemblies for Xamarin.Sdk have link tasks" (#4101) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Our existing Xamarin.iOS project is in the process of a major refactor. Part of this has included relying more on NuGet, although I am not certain that is this the root of the problem.  Currently our project builds and runs fine on the simulator, but if we try to build for a device we get 
```
error MT0099 : Internal error : Not all assemblies for Xamarin.Sdk have link tasks.
```
I have not yet been able to figure out the exact cause of the issue.

1.  Build Release Project for Generic Device

3.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Detect invalid delegate names in AdoptsAttribute and show a better error." (#4107) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
See #4094 for how a customer ran into this.

Test case:

```csharp
[Adopts ("Foo.Bar")]
class Foo : NSObject
{
}
```

results in:

```
/.../registrar.m(35722,30): error G65037BDE: expected '>'
/.../registrar.m(35722,18): error GC919C233: type arguments cannot be applied to non-parameterized class 'NSObject'
/.../registrar.m(35722,30): error G9772CD21: cannot use dot operator on a type
MTOUCH : error MT4109: Failed to compile the generated registrar code. Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[runtime] Avoid using a static library initializer." (#4106) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Avoid using a static library initializer by using a constant recursive mutex
initializer.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ObjCRuntime] Reorder statements slightly to avoid doing useless work in certain scenarios." (#4105) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
We don't need the 'map' variable until after we've checked if the dynamic
registrar is supported, which means we can fetch it at that point too.

This improves the scenario when the dynamic registrar is not supported, since
in that case all subsequent code will be optimized away.

1. 
```
